Marek Hamsik was so delighted with his goal for Napoli he ran to the corner flag and destroyed it. Literally destroy it.

Sliding into the corner he aimed his right boot at the flag and snapped it into pieces.

But what the punk-haircut Slovakian striker didn’t realise was his 63rd minute goal against SPAL was to be disallowed.

Wrestling Observer’s Dave Meltzer has reported that WWE are interested in Gronkowski, and are willing to make him a Ronda Rousey style offer to switch to wrestling.

The former England midfielder hung up his boots in 2011, but returned to the Manchester United side just six months later as the Red Devils missed out on the title on goal difference.

Barcelona midfielder Andres Iniesta has backed former boss Luis Enrique to be a huge success at Chelsea should he replace Antonio Conte at Stamford Bridge.

The Italian manager is under pressure after a string of disappointing domestic results, though his side have won their last two matches and are now preparing to take on Barca in the Champions League.

It has been suggested that owner Roman Abramovich could pull the trigger on Conte if Chelsea are knocked out and has Enrique lined up – and Iniesta believes he can win silverware.

Chelsea midfielder Cesc Fabregas has revealed that his relationships with his friends at Barcelona have been affected by the upcoming Champions League tie between his current and former sides.

The Blues host the Spanish side on Tuesday in the first-leg of their Round of 16 tie.

It will see Fabregas come up against his former side and the one he readily admits is the team he supports.

Fabregas remains close with many of the Barcelona players, with the 30-year-old regularly taking holidays with their star player Lionel Messi. Paul Pogba’s exit from Manchester United in 2012 was in part triggered by Phil Jones being selected ahead of him, Paul Scholes has claimed.

The Frenchman left for Juventus having grown frustrated at his lack of first-team opportunities at Old Trafford when an 18-year-old.

The moment he decided to go came when Sir Alex Ferguson selected Phil Jones and Fabio da Silva in central midfield ahead of him for a Premier League game against Blackburn.

Juventus have suffered yet another injury blow after Gonzalo Higuain was forced off in the Turin derby, potentially throwing his participation against Tottenham Hotspur into doubt.

The Old Lady are currently in the midst of an injury crisis, with Blaise Matuidi, Juan Cuadrado and Paulo Dybala all absent from the Champions League last 16, first leg against Spurs, which was drawn 2-2.

Illness claimed Mario Mandzukic ahead of the trip to face local rivals Torino on Sunday, and now Higuain has joined the growing injury list.

Ernesto Valverde said his decision to relegate Philippe Coutinho to the bench for Barcelona’s latest La Liga contest was for the good of the team.

There was surprise that the £142million signing was not in the starting XI to play Eibar as he is ineligible to play in Barcelona’s Champions League contest with Chelsea this coming week.

But rather than using Coutinho in order to give another player a rest before Tuesday, Valverde named the ex-Liverpool player on the bench before introducing him in the 60th minute.

Jose Mourinho has spoken in glowing terms about Manchester United midfielder Scott McTominay – though appears to have taken a pop at Paul Pogba in the process.

The Frenchman was absent from the Red Devils’ FA Cup win over Huddersfield on Saturday, though his younger teammate impressed in his absence as United switched to the 4-3-3 formation Pogba has craved.

Mourinho’s relationship with Pogba is believed to have broken down recently, with the United boss raging at his record signing after a recent defeat to Newcastle.

Chelsea will host Barcelona this week for the first leg of their Champions League last-16 match.

It will be the first time the two sides have met in the Champions League since 2012, which was the season that Chelsea managed to lift the trophy for the first time.

Barcelona have been in great form in La Liga and manager Ernesto Valverde has seen his side remain undefeated in the league.

Recent reports have suggested that Real are prepared to offer as much as £100 million plus Gareth Bale in a player-plus-cash deal for Hazard.

Arsenal will have to spend big to land top defensive target Chris Smalling after Manchester United named their price for the centre-back, according to reports.

The Gunners have made it a priority to strengthen their defence in the summer, with Arsene Wenger admitting he had wanted a new defender but ran out of money after breaking the club’s transfer record by signing Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang.

Jose Mourinho was involved in a furious dressing-room bust-up with Manchester United stars Paul Pogba and Phil Jones, fresh reports have revealed.

The Portuguese coach was forced to defend his relationship with Pogba after the Frenchman delivered a string of underwhelming performances, while it has even been suggested he has demanded a new position to fix the problem.

Pogba was missing from the squad that beat Huddersfield in the FA Cup on Saturday due to illness, while Jones – who has suffered a number of niggles throughout the season – was rested.

Jose Mourinho admits he is unsure whether Paul Pogba will be available for Manchester United’s Champions League clash with Sevilla on Wednesday night.

The Red Devils face Spanish side Sevilla in the last-16 of the competition this week but Pogba could be absent after he was ruled out of Saturday’s FA Cup win at Huddersfield Town.

Mourinho said on Friday that Pogba would feature at the John Smith’s Stadium – but United confirmed before the game that he had not travelled due to illness.
